ui_guidelines.design_system: See .github/agents/htplanner-ai-agent.md for complete UI development standards and design system
ui_guidelines.quick_reference: Football green theme (hsl(120, 45%, 25%)), responsive design, accessibility standards

framework_notes.react: Use existing button/table/card components, consistent with TailwindCSS utilities

tasks.name: plan
tasks.title: Plan the next development task
what to do: Read .github/agents/htplanner-ai-agent.md, .project/ docs for context. Use `make help` and `uv run`.
Take holistic view: consolidate, eliminate duplication, reduce waste.
Scout mindset: Do not be afraid to take a step back and fix fix more than in the task
Structure: # Plan ## Analysis ## Solution ## Steps ## Testing
Break large tasks into sub-tasks. Simplify ruthlessly.
Do not code in this step.

tasks.name: execute
tasks.title: Execute the planned development task
what to do: Read .github/agents/htplanner-ai-agent.md, .project/ docs. Use `uv run` and `make help`.
Follow plan. Scout mindset: fix lint errors, fix file format standards issues, cleanup nearby code, remove waste while working, don't settle for the same code coverage but strive to improve it.
Apply simplification hierarchy: Holistic view >> Separation of concerns >> Reduce complexity >> Reduce waste >> Consolidate duplication.
Test: `make test-all` - no coverage loss or failures.
UI: Use ui_guidelines colors/typography. Flask: .btn-primary-custom classes. React: existing components.
Update docs. Note new tasks for backlog. Break large tasks into sub-tasks.
Do not commit code.

tasks.name: review
tasks.title: Critical review of recent development work
what to do: Review changes since last commit. Be critical, not celebratory.
Structure: ## What Was Done ## Critical Analysis ## Missed Opportunities ## Questions
What Was Done: 3-4 bullet points max. Facts only, no praise.
Critical Analysis: What could have been simpler? What seems over-engineered? What creates new dependencies or complexity?
Missed Opportunities: What obvious improvements were skipped? What cleanup was ignored?
Questions: Challenge 2-3 decisions. Why this approach vs alternatives? What are the downsides?
Test: `make test-all` - note failures and quality regressions.
Add specific improvement tasks to backlog based on identified issues.
Do not commit code.

tasks.name: update
tasks.title: Update project status and planning
what to do: Add suggestions from the 'review' prompt to backlog.md unless already present or can be merged.
STEP 1: Read .project/backlog.md and identify ALL completed tasks (marked ✅ COMPLETE or OBSOLETE).
STEP 2: For EACH completed and obsolete task found, DELETE the completed task from backlog.md (git preserves history).
STEP 3: DELETE the corresponding task file from .project/tasks/<taskid>.md for each completed task (git preserves history).
STEP 4: Review backlog.md for holistic consolidation opportunities.
STEP 5: Compare 'make help' with the rules in the Makefile, do not leave DEPRECATED entries.
STEP 6: Unblock dependencies. Update docs to reflect current state.
CRITICAL: The backlog must be completely clean of ✅ COMPLETE tasks after this prompt. Search systematically for '✅.*COMPLETE' pattern and remove ALL matches.
Do not commit code.

tasks.name: commit
tasks.title: Create commits for changes since last commit following git guidelines
what to do: Analyze changes and additions since last commit. Group related changes logically.
Check for feature additions: Look for FEAT- tasks marked complete, new functionality, or feature implementations.
Write factual commit messages: <50 char subject, body: imperative mood, no fluff, refer to issues if possible.
For feature commits: Add unique identifier suffix like [feat-abc123] or [feature-xyz] to enable version counting.
Feature detection patterns: FEAT- task completion, Add feature, Implement, new functionality.
Stage and commit. Don't push.
git status should be clean after.

tasks.name: add-to-backlog
tasks.title: Add a new task to the project backlog with simplification focus
what to do: Read .github/agents/htplanner-ai-agent.md, .project/ docs. Check for duplicate work.
Challenge: can this be simplified or merged with existing tasks?
Create detailed task file at .project/tasks/<taskid>.md with Problem Statement, Implementation, Acceptance Criteria.
Add summary entry to backlog.md Current Focus and Priority sections with link to task file.

tasks.name: execute-backlog-item
tasks.title: Plan and execute a specific backlog item with simplification focus
what to do: Read .github/agents/htplanner-ai-agent.md, .project/ docs. Challenge if task can be simplified.
Read detailed requirements from .project/tasks/<taskid>.md file.
Scout mindset: fix lint errors, cleanup nearby code while executing.
Execute with `uv run`. Test against acceptance criteria.
Update docs. Mark completed in backlog (✅ COMPLETED with completion notes).
IMPORTANT: After marking complete, immediately delete the completed task from backlog.md to keep backlog clean.
DELETE the task file .project/tasks/<taskid>.md (git preserves history).
Structure: # Execution: [TASK-ID] ## Plan ## Steps ## Summary

tasks.name: analyze-project
tasks.title: Repository analysis for simplification and complexity reduction
what to do: Use list_dir and file_search to analyze repository structure with focus on simplification.
Take a holistic view: identify duplication, waste, over-engineered solutions, and unnecessary complexity.
Review all docs (README.md, .project/*, DEPLOYMENT.md) for redundancy and outdated content.
Find opportunities to consolidate, merge, or eliminate redundant components and processes.
Create backlog tasks for: simplification, deduplication, waste reduction, complexity reduction.
Structure: # Analysis ## Simplification Opportunities ## Duplication & Waste ## Complexity Reduction ## Actions

tasks.name: organize-backlog
tasks.title: Organize and clean up project backlog with simplification focus
what to do: Read .project/ docs. Holistic view for consolidation opportunities.
Apply simplification hierarchy: Holistic view >> Reduce complexity >> Reduce waste >> Consolidate duplication.
Validate task relevance: Check if BUG-, DOC-, REFACTOR-, INFRA- tasks are still valid/needed. FEAT- tasks should generally remain unless superseded.
Identify: complexity (monoliths, unclear responsibilities), waste (unused code, redundant logic), inappropriate consolidation (merging distinct tools).
Respect separation of concerns: Don't merge tasks with different purposes.
Consolidate duplicate tasks. Remove obsolete. Simplify complex tasks.
Look for patterns: combine small tasks, simplify over-engineered solutions.
Fix dependencies/priorities to reduce cognitive load.

tasks.name: look-outside-the-box
tasks.title: Generate innovative opportunities
what to do: Scan backlog.md, goals.md for existing suggestions.
Simplification Challenge: What if we eliminated 50% of features?
Black Hat: Question 2-3 fundamental decisions. What could collapse the project?
Techniques: Contrarian questions, industry analogies, radical simplification.
Add high-value suggestions to backlog.md or goals.md as appropriate.
Structure: # Innovation ## Assessment ## Challenges ## Opportunities
